required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Investigate the Potential Drug-Drug Interaction Between Elafibranor and Indomethacin
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1, Open-label Study, in Healthy Male Volunteers to Evaluate the Potential Effect of Indomethacin on the Pharmacokinetics Parameters of Elafibranor

brief_summary.textblock: The enzyme responsible for the conversion of elafibranor into its active metabolite, GFT1007, has not been formally identified, but it is believed to have similar characteristics to an α,β-ketoalkene reductase previously identified in rat liver cytosol. In vitro studies in human liver cytosol fractions have shown that indomethacin inhibits the enzyme responsible of the transformation of elafibranor into GFT1007. As a result, indomethacin was included in the list of prohibited co-medications in all clinical trials with elafibranor, and a formal Drug-Drug Interaction (DDI) clinical study is being conducted to elucidate the effect of indomethacin on elafibranor pharmacokinetics.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Open-label, one sequence crossover, single-centre, single group assignment Phase 1 study in healthy male Caucasians volunteers, aged between 18-50 years old (inclusive)

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma pharmacokinetics: Area under curve from dosing time to infinity (AUC(0-∞))
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.17, 0.33, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120, 144, 168, 192 and 216 hours post-dose (336 and 384 hours post-dose added in sequence 2)

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma pharmacokinetics: Maximum plasma drug concentration (Cmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.17, 0.33, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120, 144, 168, 192 and 216 hours post-dose (336 and 384 hours post-dose added in sequence 2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma pharmacokinetics: Area under curve from dosing time to infinity (AUC(0-∞))
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.17, 0.33, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120, 144, 168, 192 and 216 hours post-dose (336 and 384 hours post-dose added in sequence 2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma pharmacokinetics: Maximum plasma drug concentration (Cmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.17, 0.33, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120, 144, 168, 192 and 216 hours post-dose (336 and 384 hours post-dose added in sequence 2)

other_outcome.measure: Plasma pharmacokinetics: Area under curve from dosing time to last measurement (AUC(0-t))
other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.17, 0.33, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120, 144, 168, 192 and 216 hours post-dose (336 and 384 hours post-dose added in sequence 2)
Pre-dose and at 0.17, 0.33, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120, 144, 168, 192 and 216 hours post-dose (336 and 384 hours post-dose added in sequence 2)

other_outcome.measure: Plasma pharmacokinetics: Time of maximum observed concentration (tmax)
other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.17, 0.33, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120, 144, 168, 192 and 216 hours post-dose (336 and 384 hours post-dose added in sequence 2)

other_outcome.measure: Plasma pharmacokinetics: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve extrapolated from time t to infinity as a percentage of total area under the plasma concentration-time curve (%AUCextra)
other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.17, 0.33, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120, 144, 168, 192 and 216 hours post-dose (336 and 384 hours post-dose added in sequence 2)
Pre-dose and at 0.17, 0.33, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120, 144, 168, 192 and 216 hours post-dose (336 and 384 hours post-dose added in sequence 2)

other_outcome.measure: Plasma pharmacokinetics: Apparent volume of distribution (Vd/F)
other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and at 0.17, 0.33, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120, 144, 168, 192 and 216 hours post-dose (336 and 384 hours post-dose added in sequence 2)

arm_group.description: Period 1: study of elafibranor's pharmacokinetics Period 2: study of elafibranor's pharmacokinetics under CHRONO-INDOCID® (indomethacin) at steady state

intervention.description: Elafibranor 120mg is a coated tablet for oral administration
CHRONO-INDOCID 75mg is a capsule for bis in die (bid) oral administration
